channel.title: Webroot SecureAnywhere AntiVirus
channel.description:
Anybody ever used this? I am getting mixed reviews on the internet about this. Some say it works like Norton and other reviews state that it "has a 9.9 rating which is supposedly the highest malware catch rating..."
I'm asking because of this:
http://www.bestbuy.com/site/Misc/Deal-of-the-Day/pcmcat248000050016.c?id=pcmcat248000050016
deal of the day today is webroot for 10$ :D can't really beat that.

item.title: Webroot SecureAnywhere AntiVirus
item.dc:creator: @doom_j doom_j
item.description:
@doom_j wrote:

[quote=“Loveandpower, post:6, topic:522103”][quote author=iCreatedHorror link=topic=640608.msg4316471#msg4316471 date=1371570025]
I have it and I’ve yet to see anything get passed it. Then again, if you’re not doing something stupid and you’re careful, then you should be fine with anything.
[/quote]haha very true.

[hr][quote author=Jmood link=topic=640608.msg4316468#msg4316468 date=1371569833]
Another suggestion is a sand boxing program for things like your browser.
[/quote]
has limitations[/quote]

So do anti virus, So do any security techniques you will ever put into place.

Read full topic

item.title: Webroot SecureAnywhere AntiVirus
item.dc:creator: @Loveandpower Loveandpower
item.description:
@Loveandpower wrote:

[quote=“Jmood, post:2, topic:522103”]When my parents bought a computer package deal it came with Webroot installed on every computer, everyone still got hit by hijacks and other malware. When in doubt just use the anti virus software Microsoft is giving out free. ;)[/quote]I kind of got that feeling anyway but I’d still like more comments on this before I even consider either way. ( I currently use a free Norton package I get with comcast)

Read full topic
